Description: Finger-ring consisting of a dark-blue opaque glass scarab, elytra marked, pierced longitudinally, base inscribed with a cartouche, containing the prenomen and epithets of Hatshepsut, mounted in gold, elaborated with granulation, and attached to a stirrup-shaped hoop, also of gold.
Curator's comments: Published: Les amour d'une princesse égyptienne, Saint-Gérard 1997, pp.115, 152 [52].
Exhibition history: Exhibited: 1997 May-Oct, Abbaye Saint-Gerard De Brogne, Le Roman de la momie
